comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/abaraphobia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gerryward] Hold on, chaps, before we start divvying up the sausages! This photo was taken in 1930. However, the Ferrybank history text says: "... In 1934 it was decided to establish a bacon curing plant at Christendom with help from a Danish company which set up the factory and ran it in the early years until it was then taken back under Irish management. At this time the emerging factory changed its name to Clover Meats Limited. ..."
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 55597723@N02
comment._content: Nice  Photo of those items back then. I love Sausages & Pudding.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Are those inverted bucket shaped items white pudding or brawn?  I never saw pudding outside of a skin until very recently and I was brought up in a centre of excellence for bacon and the finest Limerick ham!!!
